p: Taken together, a crisis necessitates a transformation of the science toward more socially and ethically engaged research. The coronavirus crisis has put a normal life of people on hold, requiring to not go back to the old normal but move onto the new normal. With a sense of urgency of the climate crisis, many people understand the politics must go beyond business as usual. Likewise, this is—and should be—a moment of change in our way of doing the science in times of crisis. It will be a moral failure of the science to keep ignoring the “black elephant” in an emergency room.
